1.text: And Jonas prayed to the Lord his God out of the belly of the fish.

2.text: And he said: I cried out of my affliction to the Lord, and he heard me: I cried out of the belly of hell, and thou hast heard my voice.

3.text: And thou hast cast me forth into the deep in the heart of the sea, and a flood hath compassed me: all thy billows, and thy waves have passed over me.

4.text: And I said: I am cast away out of the sight of thy eyes: but yet I shall see thy holy temple again.

5.text: The waters compassed me about even to the soul: the deep hath closed me round about, the sea hath covered my head.

6.text: I went down to the lowest parts of the mountains: the bars of the earth have shut me up for ever: and thou wilt bring up my life from corruption, O Lord my God.

7.text: When my soul was in distress within me, I remembered the Lord: that my prayer may come to thee, unto thy holy temple.

8.text: They that are vain observe vanities, forsake their own mercy.

9.text: But I with the voice of praise will sacrifice to thee: I will pay whatsoever I have vowed for my salvation to the Lord.

10.text: And the Lord spoke to the fish: and it vomited out Jonas upon the dry land.
